verses.roman:
ity abhidhyāyato nāsā-
vivarāt sahasānagha
varāha-toko niragād
aṅguṣṭha-parimāṇakaḥ

synonyms: iti—thus; abhidhyāyataḥ—while thinking; nāsā-vivarāt—from the nostrils; sahasā—all of a sudden; anagha—O sinless one; varāha-tokaḥ—a minute form of Varāha (a boar); niragāt—came out; aṅguṣṭha—the upper portion of the thumb; parimāṇakaḥ—of the measurement.
translation: O sinless Vidura, all of a sudden, while Brahmā was engaged in thinking, a small form of a boar came out of his nostril. The measurement of the creature was not more than the upper portion of a thumb.
